result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Sentence Credit filed by Defendant. **The Court has reviewed the Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.  After a review of the court record, the Court grants the Defendant's request for five days credit.  An amended Judgment of Conviction will be filed.**

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason L. Peterson in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the amended information. 

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  - 5 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Not to use any device to access the internet
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old unless approval from agent
*Must register with the Sex Offer Registry
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is  not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason L. Peterson in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to speak with the ADA assigned to this matter before the matter resolves. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Hearing at 12-02-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Jason L. Peterson in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective MIchael Carpenter from the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Closing statements presented by Atty. Simon and requests dismissal of this case.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 10-30-2015 10:00 am

COURT ORDERED A $2500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $7500.00 Surety BOND signed by LInda Sobieszczyk.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18. Defendant to not access the internet at all.  Defendant to not use or possess  any device that is capable of accessing the internet including a smart phone.
